abstract: british bobsledder bruce tasker to miss winter olympics after minor stroke .
article: the british bobsledder bruce tasker will miss the winter olympics in pyeongchang after having a minor stroke on 4 january . the 30-year-old welshman , who is being treated for groin and hip injuries at home , was taken to wexham park hospital after experiencing dizziness and nausea . tasker was subsequently transferred to the stroke unit at high wycombe hospital on saturday . `` i 'm gutted not to be able to conclude the four-year cycle by going to the olympics but i 'm very grateful that i 'm still fit and healthy , '' said tasker , who had been due to compete in his second olympic games .

`` to me , this was a completely freak occurrence . i was unlucky to be in this situation , but i 'm lucky to have come out of it unscathed . i 'm set to make a 100 % recovery and i already feel as though i 'm most of the way there . `` tasker was part of a four-man crew who finished fifth in sochi and is expected to resume training next season . `` we are desperately sorry for bruce to lose his chance of becoming a two-time olympian so close to the pyeongchang 2018 games , '' team gb chef de mission mike hay added .
`` bruce is an outstanding person and athlete with proven leadership skills and was a hugely valued and popular member of team gb in sochi . ''
